title: Futuristic font from "The world of Lamborghini" video podcasts
content:
Link: [The World of Lamborghini video podcasts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080622142755/http:/www.apple.com/podcasts/lamborghini/lamborghini.xml)  
Seen in the Lamborghini Reventón episode.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080622142755im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ReventonPodcast_5871.png)

 [‹ Focus Cover fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080622142755/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41156 "Go to previous forum topic") [Name these fonts? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080622142755/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41316 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dedaluz

comments.content:
I think there’s a stencil version of [United Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080622142755/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/fluidum-bold/) from House, that is similar, at least.

- Mike Yanega
When I looked through United Sans the only stencil versions were in the heaviest weight of each corresponding width. I also don’t think the R in this sample is as boxy as United.
If I remember correctly, there was a free United cut like this (light stencil) couple of years before the actual typeface came out.

Nice find Marten. It’s a very versatile stencil and nicely done — [free for personal use](http://web.archive.org/web/20080622142755/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=usaaf_stencil) .

- Mike Yanega
Thank you all! It wasn’t an easy one.
